caption: Every meal here has been a delight. The pasta is superb, as is the seafood - others rave about the veal they've had - and the desserts to finish them off (get the chocolate mousse) are appropriately decadent. It's all bookended by a charming ambiance, complete with tile frescoes, Italian city-state flags, and photos of luminaries from politics (multiple presidents), film, and sports who've graced the place - not to mention a chef who never fails to come out to greet diners and ask how the meal has gone. This place doesn't get nearly enough love - it's absolutely worth a trip, or even takeout.
(Translated by Google) Delicious food  (Original) Deliciosa comida

La Perla is the best Italian Restaurant in DMV. It is so authentic and a best kept secret. You get the best of Italy from the chandeliers, frescos, paintings from Anthony Quinn to the fresh Italian cuisine. Victor, the italian owner/chef, has cooked for Catholic hierarchy and Presidents from around the globe. It is a treat to go there. It is a bucket list Restaurant.

We went to this place on a recommendation for Valentine’s Day and we absolutely will not be back. Our waiter was barely at our table, and almost never got a water refill. The food was not nearly what I expected, and the champagne cream sauce was extremely watery and bland. To top it all off, the manager was yelling on the phone for the whole dining room to hear, pointing his cane while demanding servers and bussers to do various things, also did NOT have a mask on the entire time. It was the most uncomfortable dining experience I’ve ever had.
Delicious food . Best customer service highly recommended
Delicious food and entertaining atmosphere.... great service... very Italiano!!! Loved it!!!
Loved it, great food, excellent service, charming chef, elegant old world decor.
Great food and service
Safe Italian restaurant. Not bad but not amazing.
The table outside looked so beautiful.  However muscles were not so fresh.The table mat was dirty, there were so many mosquitoes and flies, even though kind staff set up some repellent device.
Excellent

Amazingly delicious gluten free option for the eggplant parmigiana. Have been craving it ever since. Even though it is not noted on the menu, our waiter explained that many of the dishes can be prepared gluten free.

One of our all time favorite Restaurants! Delicious Lentil Soup! That Fresh Bread! Spaghetti....mmmm!! And the kind service is wonderful. The Chef makes a point to speak with and shake hands with the patrons,  How special is that 😊
Excellent Italian food on the edge of Georgetown
Great service and food
Wonderful evening with my daughters. Food, atmosphere & service... Exceptional.
Caesar salad is fantastic
Amazing food. Nice atmosphere. Great private room for groups.
Decent quality very traditional Italian restaurant. Atmosphere is wood panels, pics of Italian celebs, and Italian calcio club banners.
Nice delicious food
Excellent and authentic work of Italian food that reminds me of the times I visited Italy.
Very nice place
This place is HORRIBLE! The decor is CHEESY! There way OVERED PRICED! And it seems as if all there plates are made soupy.

My friend and I went in to get some takeout. We just saw it as we were driving by, and I was craving Italian food. It was lovely; loved the ambience, the person who greeted us at the door and took us to the bar (African dude), and our server (Asian guy) ... sorry I don’t rem the names. Wonderful people. We had glasses of wine as we waited for our meal. I LOVED the art. Incredible! I have to come back, and actually dine in. I just got lost in the art, and the ambience... I actually wanted the food to take longer 🤭😩. My food was very good! I'm definitely coming back. Grazie.
Excellent food and service.
Cool!

The food was honesty terrible for the price. Would rather give my money to OG. Italian wine was a bust. They treated us as irrelevant due to our age as well. Fried calamari appeared to be from Sysco. Homemade pasta was okay but flavors lacked. The vibe wasn’t attractive either. Kind server however.
Fantastic food and service. Will definitely be back!
Amazing food and very nice attention. At the end of dinner we were greeted by the owner and chef!!

Do not go here! We ordered a cheesecake after our meal and half way through eating it the middle was full with mold! When we showed the waiter he didn’t say much he took it away. They went on to charge us the full bill and said he took the cheesecake off. So all three of us who shared it were shocked . We could have gotten sick eating molding food and no sorry he just didn’t charge us for that one item ?! When we called to talk to the manager they wouldn’t put him on the phone they put the chef on the phone and he argued with us saying we were lying he only buys the best foods to cook with. I’m still in shock not s sorry just a you’re wrong . Customer service was terrible and so was the food. I honestly have no idea how they have four stars the place was empty the entire  time just us and one other couple . Pick another restaurant to try in DC.

(Translated by Google) This is an excellent address in Washington and portraits of personalities testify. President's pasta with seafood and shellfish sauce champagne a slaughter. To do absolutely  (Original) Voilà une excellente adresse à Washington et les portraits de personnalités en témoignent. Les pâtes du Président aux fruits de mer et crustacés sauce champagne une tuerie. À faire absolument
great food and service
excellent food and service! best in town
Great food. Bring your fat wallet.

Had a great lunch! I went in by myself and I wasn't dressed nice but the staff were really friendly to me anyway. I had some delicious minestrone and a calamari salad with broccoli rabe. I would have liked the tentacles as well as the tubes, but it was really good. The decor in there is the best part. I had a book but I spent most my time staring at the paintings, flags and knick knacks. I'll definitely be back to try some pasta!
Excellent food. Excellent service.
Staff was friendly when I visited in the Summer. I sat outside drinking a Peroni.
(Translated by Google) Nice restaurant, relatively small and expensive dishes .... I wouldn't go back there  (Original) מסעדה נחמדה, מנות קטנות ויקרות באופן יחסי....לא הייתי חוזר לשם
Fantastic food. Great service. Nice atmosphere even when going on a quiet evening. The white chocolate dessert was amazing!

The appetizer and dessert were delicious but the actual pasta wasn't. My pasta was super bland and I had to ask for a lot of cheese and pepper to give it any flavor. My friend got the tortellini and it was better but still shy on best flavor. The staff was friendly but not very attentive. I had to ask multiple times for the dessert menu and the check. Also we were a bit off to the edge so we almost never got a water refill. So it was good but certainly not great.
Very cold service ! They don’t care you , only care tips!  The foods Are so so also , the place is very beautiful! For the price , Not a great experience!
Really good authentic Italian food. A pleasant dining experience. Reservations recommended.
Beautiful older restaurant with a gorgeous bathroom. Good menu and wonderful service but food quality was okay. We both had pasta and thought our dishes were adequate.

Seemed like an ordinary Italian restaurant that just puts very simple recipes together that anyone can make at home and forgot to put much salt. The chickens are tenderized through mallet-pounding so the chickens are very small amounts for the outrageously expensive price. Adding chicken to a meal is $9 (tiny 3 slices of chicken breast, it seemed small). No cocktails on the menu. My friend and I got sick 45 minutes after this place. My friend had the Chicken Alfredo and vomited, I only took one bite of my friend's meal, (it's possible it was the butter with the bread) and got only a little bit sick with trips to the bathroom but no vomiting. As for the positives: I liked the Italian decor and liked the Chicken Francesca sauce. I asked the restaurant to throw away whatever cream they used, but instead they were so kind and nice that they asked me to come back the next morning and try the cream again like a guinea pig. They said they would save me the Alfredo sauce cream to try again because of how confident they are that it is clean.  They stand by their product!
The best food

The very attentive and professional service staff, and the decor - plus their lovely outdoor patio, overlooking a small park - are the takeaways from our first visit to La Perla.  Food was very good, especially the lighter veal dishes.  Gnocchi was excellent, but might have been improved with the substitution of a veal ragu vs. the bolognese which was offered.  Marinara was very subtle and finely done.  Tiramisu was heavenly - could easily have had a second piece!  A refined, and maybe preferred if you're feeling that way, alternative to Filomena's in the Georgetown area - we'll definitely be back!
Low quality food with high prices
Excellent service, Delicious food, Great ambiance  !! Absolutely love this restaurant  !!!
Awesome food.
Not all that great. Dinner was not prepared as requested. One waiter proceeded to argue with one of our dinner guests regarding his selection and what was served.
Great food! Superb service! Don't miss this treat!

This restaurant was one of the best I have eaten at in a long time. From the appetizers to the desert, it was perfect. The entrees were unbelievable.  The service was wonderful and on point. The head chef came and introduced himself and even gave us some mosquito spray (we were sitting outside, which was beautiful by the way)! I highly recommend La Perla and we will be returning if we are ever back in the area. I would give 6 stars if I could!
Lovely, low-key ambience. Food and service were superlative. Definitely recommended.

It is significant that my two 13 year old grandkids loved the food as did my wife and  I.  This is an upscale restaurant but allows some casual dress.  I recommend business casual.  The wait staff was very efficient and knowledgeable.  The chef/owner came to our table and spent a good amount of time.  The atmosphere is beautiful.
Awesome
Beautiful restaurant with excellent food.

One of the best places I have ate at. The food is worth every bite. The atmosphere is unique. The serving staff is top notch. One of DC must see spots of political history. Politicians, Foreign agencies, etc. Come here in DC to try at least try once.

Overpriced! Quality of food poor.  Fried calamari was chewy small portion and did not look appetizing- I could have gotten better at a fast food place.  The waiter was without any emotions.  And the main course was disappointing!
Wonderful, delicious.
Everything they serve is absolutely amazing. Fresh, good quality, well-prepared!
The service was great! The main course was good but I wasn’t wowed enough to go back. The place is always packed so I kinda expected more. The salad and bread were below average.
Fantastic restaurant, these places are disappearing by the day...go before its a Panera

(Translated by Google) Excellent Ambienté very nice care. Rich dishes and very clean all total hygiene 👌🏻  (Original) Excelente Atención   Ambienté muy agradable. Ricos platillos  y muy  limpio todo higiene total  👌🏻
Very embarrassing to be the witness and hear the chef screaming at it employees during our diner , our pasta were over cooked and the tomato sauce very very sweet , this place is over rated
No school like the old school. Most authentic Italian food! Won't disappoint!

(Translated by Google) Good Italian dishes. Attention service. The boss Vittorio is very friendly. A good address.  (Original) Bons plats italiens. Service attentionne. Le patron Vittorio est tres sympathique. Une bonne adresse.
I've been going here for years. Always amazing!
Great food, but pricey.
Simple, authentic and delicious.  Well trained staff.  Wonderful decor.
Lovely setting, convenient, tasty food, attentive staff. Just right.
When the owner chef attend to every table.  I call that excellence

Very overpriced. Honestly the portions and presentation were bad. The taste of the food was average at best, slightly better than a typical home cooked meal. For what they were charging, and for the reputation they have, I really expected better. I live in the neighborhood and this is the first time I went and it will likely be the last.
Amazing little Italian spot in Georgetownish area. Tried the Salmon with veggies & potatoes. Was soooooo good!!

This is a very nice restaurant for a special occasion. The service was great. The owner is an adorable little gnome who comes to every table. The limoncello is homemade as is everything else. Perfect for Valentine's day.

Had our rehearsal dinner here. Lively and lovely spot with charm. We had almost 30 people so we were too large for their PDR and sat in 2 long tables in the main dining room. We used a pre-selected choices of menu items and all the food and wines were delicious. The only down side was the amount of time it took between courses to deliver the food to our tables, especially between starter course and entree took a very long time, we had to ask them to speed up service. Dinner took 3+ hours.

Delicious authentic Italian food. The ingredients tasted high quality and fresh. The flavors and seasonings were complexed and yet simple and excitedly engaged all of my tastebuds. The service was excellent. All the staff were professional and very very Friendly. The Chef and owner came out multiple times to chat with us and other guests about the food. It was an amazing experience.
Really good

Wonderful menu. There was so much on it that I wanted to try that I'm just going to have to come back again when I'm in town.  Cozy atmosphere with music but not too loud so you can carry on a comfortable conversation. Waiters were great and provided wonderful service and were very attentive to our needs.  I had ravioli stuffed with roast beef and four cheese in a cream and tomato soup sauce I believe and it was amazing.  Hope I am able to get back again to try some of their other menu items.

Very special place. I hosted an important event there for a very dear person to me and her family and they took the event as seriously as I did. From the warm greeting to my guests to their kind and helpful interaction through the night, their rich menu... everything was perfect. Very professional and friendly staff. I will remember this beautiful place and the evening we had there.

The best Italian in all of D.C.  A restaurant where the chef wants to hear your opinions and takes them seriously into consideration. The staff is excellent.  The food is fresh, well prepared and served in a manner that is not too slow or too fast. I highly recommend the Chicken Sinatra.

Overall good experience. Don’t let the appearance deter you. It looks fancy, but reasonably priced for Georgetown (but on the pricier side compared to typical Italian restaurants). This place does tend to draw a number of college kids, which may or may not be your cup of tea. I learned that the pasta wasn’t made from scratch, so the experience wasn’t truly authentic. The sauces were made from scratch. The taste was good, but nothing spectacular. Service was a bit slow and the server kept trying to pressure me into getting additional food items I didn’t want. What really made my first experience memorable was that the owner/chef personally came out to see how I liked my meal and insisted I try one of his favorite pastas on the house.
This is one of the best places I've been to in a very long time it's a must go

One of the best restaurants I ever been. Its a high class reataurant with very reasonable menu prices. You will find top class menu and the best chefs and servers. The maitre d' will ensure you celebration your special occasions with style. The owner even out to check on my wife and I
Delicious, but the pasta is not homemade.

(Translated by Google) A disaster! The worst Italian restaurant ever tested! Too much pasta bathing in a kind of soup - supposed to be a pesto sauce. Everything but Italian food! Attention cherry on the cake: exorbitant prices ...  (Original) Une catastrophe! Le pire restaurant italien jamais testé! Des pâtes beaucoup trop cuites baignant dans une espèce de soupe - censée être une sauce au pesto. Tout sauf de la cuisine italienne ! Attention cerise sur le gâteau : prix exorbitants...
Good food and service. The Caprese appetizer was a bit small, but overall the serving sizes were good.
Good food. The owner is very nice and humble
We had a family dinner this weekend and all 9 people loved our food! Service was also great! Next time we will have to save room for dessert!! It looked amazing!!
Amazing authentic Italian food! Very nice atmosphere and the chef came out and talked to all the tables! Must try their homemade limoncello it was better than I’ve had in Italy
Had the Veal Parmigiana. Was very tasty.
What a treat! Wonderful service and amazing food with old world charm. Try the profiterole. You'll be glad you did.

It was my birthday dinner and things weren't going as planned.....sat down and we're told no one was in the kitchen, of course I was disappointed but the owner came out, explained the situation and insisted on making us something which ended up better than anything we could order off the menu! Overall a memorable night! Thank you chef!
Sweetest chef in the world! Gluten free options that he even gave input and enthusiasm over!❤
Fantastic food! The president pasta plate was simply amazing. The chef is also very nice. He stopped by our table and had a great conversation with us. A must go restaurant.
Not worth the price.

Haven't had such good Italian food since I went to Italy! Yummy food, good selection of wine and cozy, intimate ambiance. We ordered: Burrata, Smoked Salmon Crostini, Puttanesca, Tagliata Al Gorgonzola, Frutt 'E Mar, and Tiramisu

This place has some of the best classical Italian food (primarily pasta) in Washington D.C. Where Carmine's is great for pasta, La Perla is exceptional as a family owned non-chain fancy restaurant, and it has the native clientele to prove it. Highly recommended for anyone visiting the city or for a nice evening out.
Terrific food and prompt service.  The lovely chef/owner walks around to meet guests and will often make something for you if it is not on the menu.

Ristorante La Perla was definitely an Italian restaurant that I felt strongly attached to. I loved their pappardalle del presidente. I loved the service and the owner was very grateful to my guests, especially my mother. It's really a restaurant that I think has the supurb quality and improvement in Italian cuisine. I heavily recommend anyone to dine there, including tourists, students, elite, and family members. I only have one thing to say, Viva La Perla!
Wonderful and warm atmosphere with an excellent staff. The menu is eclectic and everything was perfectly prepared.
Great.  One of The Best.
We eat here whenever we come to D.C. Food and service were perfect.
Excellent food!! Great service and wonderful atmosphere. Definitely a great restaurant to visit while in Washington, DC.

A very special dinner from the time we entered until we left. Prices were more than reasonable for the quality of food offered.It was a memorable dinner that had my wife talking about it for days afterwards.
Excellent  food & service!
Excellent food...the chef came out to meet us personally and to make us feel like family.  I will definitely come back!
One of the best high-end Italian resturant ...its a must if you are visiting DC....delicious food & elegant atmosphere 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Always consistent.  The cuisine is exceptional.  The warm and inviting atmosphere equally compliments the experience.  Have been there multiple times.  Will continue to visit each time in DC.
Delicious food and desserts, great service!
(Translated by Google) The most exquisite gastronomy and excellent service.  (Original) La más exquisita gastronomía y excelente servicio.
This is a great restaurant for taking a client

Everything Wonderful: Food, Service, Ambiance, Location... Food. Great surprise!  After wandering around Georgetown and finding long waits at the higher rated Italian restaurants there, we literally stumbled across this restaurant just on the other side of the Creek. We were do glad we did. The host was so gracious about getting us a table. The place reminded us a wonderful neighborhood Italian restaurant... full of families, couples, and it based upon the staff interactions, filled with regulars. A great sign. Our server was a real treat...polite, smiling, helpful and always on top of making sure we had water & bread. As an appetizer, had the Mozerella Di Bufala Caprese for two... a huge piece of cheese on top of a crisp tomato slice...and they brought the oil and vinegar separately so we can drizzle to perection. For the entree, we had the Veal Marsala and Penne Con Vodka. I truly believe the Veal Marsala was the best I've ever had. The Penne Con Vodka sauce had roasted red pepper in it, which added a beautiful taste to a traditional version. The serving portion was perfect... we ate it all, and were perfectly satisfied. We loved this place...and will be back on future visits to DC for sure.
I had the worst gnocchi. The sauce was oily and not tasty at all

Great food and great services. Lasagne was great and the snapper was cooked to perfection. However the prawns in one of the lunch special menus weren't fresh at all. Still a great place and I would highlu recommend visiting.
the food is tasty made from fresh ingredients. the owner of the restaurant is the chef himself. he  make sure to visit  every table once they have eaten their meal
The best Italian food in DC.

My wife and I lived in Italy and Sicily for a total of five years.  Dining at La Perla brought back all of the wonderful memories of those five years.  Chef Testa is the ultimate host.  We were greeted by the Chef as we entered the restaurant and were made to feel like long lost friends who had returned.The food is authentic and outstanding!  Chef Testa is a culinary genius.  The service is superbly provided by a team of knowledgeable professionals.  La Perla is now our "go to" restaurant for all special occasions as well as simply to have a date night out for dinner.  Molto Grazie Chef Testa and La Perla!
Very good food and service
Amazing location, food, service
Very romantic and lovely place. Food and wine very good and atmosphere inspiring. Like Italy...
Very slow kitchen; food is only okay
Awso.e place
Low portions, expensive food
I had linguine in white clam sauce, and it was fantastic.

The food is worth every single penny here!  This was such wonderful way to end the trip my husband and I took to celebrate or 1 year anniversary along with a baby moon. My husband got the pesto pasta and I got the scallopini chicken limone which came with a side of pasta with marinara sauce on it. Now my husband is a picky eater and he lovedddd his dish and I am stilllllll wishing I had ordered a second played of mine just to bring it back to the hotel lol. My food was absolutely incredible and the marinara sauce was sooooo good that it was probably the best I’ve had thus far!!  For dessert I had the chocolate gelato and omggggg so amazing. Incredibly rich in flavor and not heavy feeling. My husband got his favorite, the cannoli and he lovedddd it too and long with a cappuccino. Not one things we both had was not AMAZING!  This is an upscale restaurant and it’s nice to see how people come appropriately dressed upon arrival. Reminds me of when I was a kid and my grandparents used to take my family or to dinner and we always got dressed up and everyone else there was dressed well too. Definitely not a t-shirt and jeans kind of place. So lovely!!  Not only that, the owner/chef came to shake our hands and great us. Most places don’t do that anymore and should take notes. It’s an incredibly nice thing to do as well as being proper and polite.  I wish this restaurant was near me at home in NY. Can’t wait to visit DC again and to come back here for their wonderful food and ambiance!  Great food, great service, great everything!!!  Thank you again for a wonderful experience!
Excellent cuisine and service!
Took an hr to get food, service was mediocre, prices vs portion were high
Best Italian I've had in years! Attentive wait staff, chef checked on food after service, all wonderful, and the tiramasu was spectacular.
One of the best fine Italian restaurants anywhere

(Translated by Google) Good food careful attention pleasant place somewhat high prices but not exaggerated  (Original) Buena comida atecion esmerada lugar agradable precios algo elevados pero no exagerados

The food was delicious and the service was just as good. The decor was excellent and I found myself gazing around the room looking at all the features hanging from the wall. Throughout the night I watch the owner come out and individually introduced himself to everybody in the room. I was impressed to see an owner have that much pride in his establishment and care so much if the customers were satisfied.
Great restaurant, friendly staff. The food was amazing and the whole experience was good. over average prices.

There is absolutely no way I can possibly accurately review Ristorante La Perla in words...the food is beyond the ability to string words together into a meaningful sentence that would even possibly start to do it justice.  I had the privilege of eating here while on a vacation to Washington with my wife and my mother-in-law and the most ironic thing is we simply stumbled upon this place while looking for a place we could eat within walking distance of our hotel...I would classify this as the find of the century.  Though it sits in an unassuming building just across from several embassies, one could easily walk right by with no concept that one of the best meals you will ever have in your entire life is behind the simple glass door of this establishment.  Genuinely amazing food, everything we ordered filled every sense we had with enjoyment and pleasure, the smell, the taste...astonishing.  I had a Chicken Parisian that simply melted in the mouth and had absolutely no flavor of anything that wasn't natural goodness.  In all of my years I can honestly say that the meal I had at Ristorante La Perla was one of the best meals of my life and one that I will no doubt repeat the next time I visit Washington DC.

Great Italian food in an authentic manner - good natural flavors. A friend had venison, another had quail, I had occo bucco with milan-style rice. Everything ordered was delicious. Wine selection was good. Had a Bolgheri and a super Tuscan.
The foods was ok. It  was too pricey for the portion size and taste.
Good Italian food. Not sure it is worth the high price, but very tasty.
Food is nothing special, dessert was very good. The service was incredibly slow. Far from good experience.
Very good service.
Delicious food, professional staff, awesome chef/owner who visits each table.  A wonderful experience!
Food is good, it took a long time to serve, portions not so big
Quiet atmosphere good food
love the service & the food is spectacular
Excellent cuisine and service
Maybe the best food I've ever had

What a great little place. Old world service and real deal freshly made Italian meals. My wife and had dinner here before attending a show at the Kennedy Center. A Great way to start the evening.  Our servers were friendly and very professional. Our waiter (George) made us feel welcome and was more than willing to answer all our questions and made suggestion that made the meal special.  My wife had a seafood special that was fresh and delicious, I had the VITELLO MARSALA CON FUNGHI. The veal was fork tender with the marsala wine sauce and mushroom done to perfection.  This was not an inexpensive dinner, but it was worth every penny. We truly enjoyed our dining experience and will return soon.
Delicious Italian food! My family had a great experience and would absolutely go back next time we are in DC!
Food was very tasty but small portion sizes
Great service, vast menu with all your favorites and more.
Honestly the best Italian dinner I have ever had. Service was impeccable and food was second to none. Can't wait to come back.

They have a nice selection of hot and cold anti pasta. It all looked so good  it was hard to make a choice. I chose the salmon and was not disappointed. The rigatoni with homemade sausage , shrimp and scallops was  incredible!  I had to use the fresh bread to get every bit of sauce from my plate.  The staff were very attentive with out hovering around. They made good food and wine selections.  The Chef came to the table and really cared about our experience.  Very memorable meal!
Just at the foot of Georgetown. Wonderful food, great service, $$.
Here you will find that pasta you've been craving for years!
Great meal and great service. Also quiet enough to easily carry on a conversation.

Had the pleasure of dining here for the first this past weekend. The food was amazing. Service was fantastic and the chef/owner is constantly checking on patrons. Great house made desserts and we were treated to complimentary lemoncello, house made. Great experience
Omg. Delicious! Everything!!

Got into DC a little late. This place was near the hotel. We called in an order well before closing. Soup, salad, and linguine with chicken-60.00. The employee said 20 minutesccome pick up the order.  We get there and get confronted by a rude manager and confused wait staff. 40 minutes later we leave with some less than appealing food. Not worth the price or wait.
Classic Italian decor - good food.
Very expensive for pasta with 3 very thin small pieces of chicken on top. Pasta tasted like supermarket brand. Service was great which is the only reason for any stars. Won't be returning.
Best Italian food on the east coast, and that includes New York. We just returned from Italy, and the food was truly identical.  Staff and owner are consistently five-star. You may quote me on this.
(Translated by Google) A quality restaurant with tasty dishes and also a very friendly service.  (Original) Un restaurant de qualité avec les plats savoureux et également un service très sympathique.
Most spectacular and fresh Italian pastas. The alla panna sauce on any pasta is a homerun!

my wife and I enjoyed our dinner. lasagna  was great, service was wonderful. and the owner checks on all the guests constantly.  He has to have some great cooks on the line while he is out conversing. The Brunette that worked Wednesday night, I commend you on your patience and I hope you are appreciated for how hard you work. Would definitely recommend.

The service was attentive. However, the waiter brought me the wrong order and I had to wait for the correct order to come out. The food was average. The meal ended with the waiter having to remove an ant from the table. The waiter brought us a free dessert for the ant outbreak.

One of the best Italian restaurants that I have ever been to. Authentic food and an amazing menu. The owner and Chef is so personable and came by making sure everyone was enjoying their meals. Homemade limencelo is to die for!!! Must try!!
Food was out of this world. The owner came out to see us, to make sure everything was to our liking. Authentic Italian, just a marvelous place.

I was super impressed with this authentically Italian restaurant. Our dear friend, a DC local, told us this was his favorite restaurant in the city. We were in town to touring colleges.  He was right! The service was perfect and the food was out of this world, starting with bread they put on the table and ending with dessert. But, wait, did I mention the bread they put on the table?! I wasn't going to even eat it until my daughters told me that I had to. And I am glad I did! It just might be the best.  Everyone ordered something different, lucky for me, so I sampled everything and LOVED each dish. When we come back to DC, this will be on our MUST-DO list.

I went a while ago with my wife, on a late night escapade! We truly enjoyed it! The food was very good and the wine too! Turned out rich people eat there, the bill was high but the quality matched the price. I would recommend to any Italian food lover!
(Translated by Google) Stylish restaurant with a touch of class. Very good food and very nice service.  (Original) Stilig restaurant med snev av klasse. Meget god mat og svært hyggelig betjening.
Really enjoyed the food. Generous portions.
Chef greeted my family at our table very pleasant. The meal was wonderful and the wait staff were tremendous. I would highly suggest this Resturaunt.
The place fabulous and the food is always scrumptious.
The food was less than average. IT IS NOT WORTH IT! Fish was dry and the pasta not tasty. THIS IS NO ITALIAN FOOD!
Great food
Food was outstanding! Had a minor issue but was corrected immediately. Owner was attentive and concerned about my experience. A definite must go.
That marinara! No words.

Very good service and delicous food.  The Zuppa Vongole (Manhattan-style clam chowder) was pefectly spiced with plenty of tender clams.  The pasta and wild boar were also very flavorful and nicely presented.  The Tiramisu was fresh and delectable.  The wine list had a very good selection, especially of Italian reds.  From start to finish, the service was very prompt, friendly and attentive.
Great place, pasta and soup were great! However, very expensive!
Good foof fast and friendly service.

Dining at La Perla was such a pleasant experience. The team members were attentive and knowledgeable of the menu.  Furthermore, they were warming and welcoming.  Definitely plan on dining at La Perla again!
(Translated by Google) The best of Italy outside of Italy  (Original) Lo mejor de Italia fuera de Italia

La Perla is located inbetween Gerogetown and Foggy Bottom. It's a classic Italian restaurant that doesn't have the most updated décor as it is "classic," but the food is exceptional. I definitely suggest to try the crispy bread instead of the dinner rolls and the scungilli dish.
not good.
Pricey and the service was just ok, but the food was excellent
(Translated by Google) The best Italian food  (Original) La mejor comida italiana

Great service! I ordered the pappardelle del presidente it was delicious! For appetizer I ordered the gamberoni al cocco.  The sauce was very tasty but the coating on the shrimp had a bit of burnt taste. Overall definitely a place to patronize.
Extremely overrated

Came by here for a solo lunch while traveling. Really nice place, formal service which was spot on. I had an order of penne all'arrabbiata, which was quite good, but not amazing. Prices are reasonable considering the high-end nature of the place. It was very big.

Service was slow, had empty glasses for the majority of our meal, and our food just wasn't good. Lasagna was very bland and basic, nothing special. The lobster and shrimp were very overcooked, like eating rubber! We were very disappointed. Go elsewhere!

I don't usually write reviews but felt compelled to do so. I accompanied a foreign dignitary to the restaurant last week. I am not sure if the gentleman is not familiar with U.S. Tipping etiquette or if he left what he felt the service merited. Our waiter followed us a block and a half to our car to tell us that the Manager was insisting for a 15% Tip. I had to translate for the gentleman who reached into his pocket and handed the waiter another bill. I don't know if it was the Manager or the waiter but I felt like we were being accosted. I have never had this experience and almost wonder what would have happened if the gentleman had not given the waiter another bill. Was he going to attack us? P.S. The food was less than average - Fish was dry and the pasta not very tasty. 8/11/16  I received a VM from the restaurant last week saying they had addressed the problem.  Then I read the owner's online response.   That is not what happened.   We did not ask for a Tax Exempt meal and that is not what the waiter said when he followed us to the car.  He specifically said his Manager was asking for a 15% tip.  So Sad!  8/15/16
From the bread, to the entrée, to the dessert, this experience was delicious at every turn.
This is the absolute BEST Italian restaurant that I have ever visited.  I love the ambiance and that the chef came out and chatted with us.
(Translated by Google) delicious  (Original) squisito

I came here for an early dinner on a Monday night so the place wasn't very crowded.  The service was great and I had the sizzling lobster pasta which was excellent.  The prices were a little steep, but I thought the dish I had matched the high price with high quality.
You can definitely taste the amount of passion and meticulous preparation given to each dish served at this amazing restaurant. I had a wonderful experience and I will surely keep coming back.
Food was all delicious and service was great. We loved the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake! I definitely plan to come back again.

Pasta with Chicken, Shrimp, and Broccoli was AMAZING!!! Best Restaurant I've Been to in DC. The owner/Chef was sooooooooo kind and generous and put his heart into cooking your food. As of right now, this is my #1 Restaurant in the DMV.
Outstanding I'll come back again 🍷🍴

This was an awesome experience with an awesome date. She picked this spot and I drive past this place all the time. The chef come out to greet you and hold a brief conversation.  And my server was great. The food was favorable, fulfilling, and my date said it was tasty. A hidden gem with great food.

I have had dinner and lunch here a number of times.  I was not too sure what to think, but I feel I can give a pretty adequate review now.  The restaurant itself is very classy and the location is amazing.  When you enter, you see certificates/awards and pictures of celebrities/ politicians that have eaten here.  The décor and atmosphere are both pretty nice.  The food is ok.  I have never walked out loving my meal.  First, the menu is HUGE!  It is a bit overwhelming.  I have tried a number of their pasta dishes.  Their pastas do not taste like they are made in house and never taste authentic.  Very ordinary.  Pasta dishes lack flavor and depth.  I don't have a better way to describe the food.  The service is strange. The staff always smile and greet you politely.  BUT they are very awkward most of the time.  First, You have to repeat what you say often for them to understand you.  Whether it be a question or you placing your order, you just have to repeat.  Maybe, it is my luck, but there is often a language barrier OR perhaps they are just not interested in what you have to say.  This could very well be the case, as there have been occasions where I have had to remind them of what I had asked for.  Multiple times.  Secondly, you feel like you are being stared at the whole time.  It is not a place where you feel comfortable sitting for hours.  I understand perhaps if they wanted to tend to their guests in a timely manner, and fulfill their requests without delay, but this is simple not the case here.  They are not attentive, and at the same time they stare.  You find yourself feeling like you are being looked at during the entire course of your meal.  It is just uncomfortable.  La Perla gives an image of Italian food at it's finest.  In my opinion, it is simply not.  Both food and service need attention.  I would also suggest specializing and eliminating items off the menu.  I would only recommend going here if you are in the area and want a nice place to sit and have your meal.  That is usually how I have ended up here.  They are local, so I wish them well and hope they pay serious attention to both their food and service.

The best in DC or any other cities I have ever dined! We do not dine out Italian unless it's in La Perla. Once you try pasta marinara here you will never be satisfied anywhere else. There is something in those sauces Chef Testa makes and they are to die for. I am a huge fan of simple dishes then if you choose fancy pasta dishes they are out of this world also! Chef Testa ensures everything is top quality.  This is also the place where you can spot famous faces (politicians, dignitaries from another countries, and movie, sport and music stars).  Great services, great atmosphere, amazing food!

Great Atmosphere, friendly greeting and new our names before we said a word; based on our reservation. Lobster ravioli had great flavor and perfect sized portion. Lasagna La Perla needed a a little more flavor. Chef came around and greeted everyone, nice touch. Desert was Tiramisu and one of the best I have had. We will go back. Menu is huge so we will try something else.
(Translated by Google) Yess  (Original) Yess
Service was gacial.  Food was average Italian.

Dined here with my buddy last Saturday... We enjoyed every part of the meal. We started with the casino clams... My buddy had the veal parm and I had the T-bone... Meeting the Chef was a nice treat and I think he must have talked to every table in the place! I would say it is the best Italian restaurant that I have dined at... Highly recommend!
Very good authentic Italian food
wonderful atmosphere, owner visits each table. thought the oysters were over priced until they came to the and were huge!
excellent service and food. Pricey but worth it.
Food was excellent! !! Fresh shrimp, fresh pasta. They have a beautiful patio. The chef came out and introduced himself. It was a wonderful experience!
Food is always phenomenal! Some of my favorites are Piatto Di Mastro Geppetto, Lasagna Partenopea, and Gnocchi with tomato sauce. So delicious!

La Perla was very nice! My wife and I were in DC on business/pleasure and decided to go there based on an OpenTable/Zagat review. I got the wild boar chops and she got the tortellini. Both were excellent and the meal wasn't as expensive as we were in expecting either. The service and the ambiance were nice as well.

We can't say enough great things about this wonderful restaurant.  My paetner and I went here to celebrate our anniversary in March 2014.  We were immediately greeted with a smile and escorted by the host to our table.  We were 15 minutes early but that didn't seem to matter!  Our server was Shahrokh and he was fantastic.  He explained the menu and answered all of our questions with ease. Chef Vittorio Testa himself came out and  talked to every table in the place, including ours ... such a friendly and warm gentleman.  The atmosphere is so peaceful and romantic here.  You can actually have a normal conversation without screaming across the table.  The food ... wow!  Everything we consumed had the perfect amount of flavor and presentation.  If you want to enjoy a quiet meal in a lovely atmosphere where the food is prepared with love,  make a reservation and plan to be pampered.
A little pricey, but very nice Italian between Foggy Bottom and DuPont.  Scene tends to be older, well-to-do.
very nice, but new york prices. we ate outside and enjoyed the streetscape.
